answers.answer: I get that from time to time, although it's not a constant thing.  It comes and goes and I think it just has to do with the way the baby is positioned.  But I think it's pretty normal either way.  The baby is getting big and taking up more room, so you're bound to be uncomfortable.  Just hang in there, not too much longer and you'll be holding your bundle of joy!!
Mention this to your doctor.  Pain on the right side under the ribs can be a symptom of something more serious going on (that doesnt mean that it is, of course).  How has your blood pressure been?

Odd lately... past few visits, some where somewhat High like 132/95 - 145/87, and recently its been around 120/70. I thought it could just be that I am nervous. I have yet to go in for my 3 hour gestational diabetes test... I am 31 weeks now, but just haven't had the time to do it yet. Hopefully I can get it done tomorrow.

OK - PLEASE mention this to your doctor ASAP.  I have gestational hypertension (based on your numbers, you do/did too) and was told if I experience continuous pain under right side of the ribs this "could" mean that the condition is getting more serious.   I am not trying to scare you because this could be nothing more than a bruised rib BUT I want to stress to you that based on some of your previous BP readings and this symptom, it is important for you to let your doctor know about this ASAP so they can do the appropriate checks if they think it is necessary (protein in urine etc.)

question: Im 31 weeks, is anyone else experiencing bad rib pain? I have horrible rib pain, mostly on my right side. It feels like it is brusied badly and hurts whenever I move, breathe or even cough. Is this normal at this stage?
title: Servere Rib pain + 31 weeks
